bibl.title: Newspaper clipping, Frank Leslie's Illustrated Newspaper, September 28, 1878

div1.p: The front page of this issue has illustrations of New York citizens donating to victims of yellow fever.

div1.head: Newspaper clipping, Frank Leslie's Illustrated Newspaper, September 28, 1878
div1.p:
FRANK LESLIE'S
ILLUSTRATED
NEWSPAPER
Entered according to the Act of Congress, in the year 1878, by FRANK LESLIE, in the Office of the Librarian of Congress at Washington.

No. 1,200--VOL. XLVII.]
NEW YORK, SEPTEMBER 28, 1878.
[PRICE, 10 CENTS. $4.00 YEARLY.
13 WEEKS, $1.00.
CITIZENS LEAVING THEIR CONTRIBUTIONS IN THE POST-OFFICE YELLOW-FEVER BOX.
RECEIVING CONTRIBUTIONS OF THE POLICE DEPARTMENT FOR THE POLICE OF THE SOUTH.

FERRY PASSENGERS DEPOSITING MONEY IN THE YELLOW-FEVER BOX AT FULTON FERRY.
NEW YORK CITY.--THE GREAT METROPOLIS HEEDING THE CRY OF DISTRESS FROM THE FEVER-STRICKEN SOUTH.--SEE PAGE 54.
